headline: Reuben Casserole
description: This tasty Reuben casserole is made with layers of sauerkraut, corned beef, Swiss cheese, rye bread crumbs, and creamy Russian-style salad dressing.
name: Reuben Casserole
recipeIngredient: 1 (16 ounce) can sauerkraut, drained and rinsed
1 pound deli sliced corned beef, cut into strips

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Spray one sheet of aluminum foil with cooking spray.
Spread bread cubes in the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Layer bread cubes with sauerkraut and beef strips, then pour dressing over top. Cover with the aluminum foil, sprayed-side down.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Remove and discard foil; sprinkle Swiss cheese over casserole. Continue baking until cheese is melted and bubbly, about 10 more minutes.

review.reviewBody: I have made this casserole several times. I use noodles instead of the bread, and make a crumb topping with panko crumbs and butter. It's delish. Since I am the only one eating this, this recipe is easy to divide in half. It's yummy. My mother always made corned beef and cabbage at St. Patrick's Day, and this recipe always brings back a fond memory. She would have loved this recipe!
family loved!!
This was fantastic and a huge hit with the whole family. So easy and quick to make. Will definitely put this in the dinner rotation.
Really easy to make. 4 ingredients. No need to add any spices. Delicious!
It was good but not as delicious as a home made grilled Reuben. My husband asked me to stick with the sandwich.
my family loves it!!! we always make it around Thanksgiving as a family tradition
This recipe is so simple and easy to make with scrumptious results!
Easy and delicious. Great for a group of people.
Deli didn't have corned beef, so used turkey. Used marble rye and thousand island dressing. Rachel or Reuben, either way will make again!

I thought it was really good and easier than making Reuban’s. The only thing I did different was melt a couple Tbs of butter and coated the bread and toasted it first while my oven was preheating then added the sourcrout and other ingredients. Was really good. Perfect for left overs corned beef.
! used ranch dressing and Jarlsberg cheese instead of thousand island and swiss cheese.
Used canned corned beef instead of fresh, used pickled slaw instead of fermented
Yummy. No changes, but need to cook longer while foil wrap on. Made extra dressing to have in hand once cooked.
Omgosh, that was so good!

My son loves this casserole, I do make a few tweaks to the recipe. I toast the breads cubes before putting them in the casserole. I also sauté the corned beef strips before laying them in the casserole. Also make sure the sauerkraut is drained and as much moisture removed as possible, otherwise the casserole is soggy,

Thought this was a great recipe. I forgot to slice the corned beef which made it feel like it had too much meat. Next time I will slice it do strips so the family does not have to use a knife while eating. Other than that it was delicious and I will defiantly make again.
Thanks,
Scott
Loved it. Have made it numerous times.

Made this recipe for dinner tonight. Didn't have the flavor of the Reuben sandwich so I don't think I'll ever make this again but it was nice to try something different for a change. Only thing I did different is use the thousand island dressing and doubled the layers of meat, sourcrout and dressing. I added bread crumbs to the bottom and the top as well. Not too bad, just wasn't the taste we wanted and was high priced.

I’ve made this many times. Once for our holiday pot luck at work. Almost every one asked for the recipe. My first time reviewing this. I toast the bread cubes in the oven before assembling the casserole. Mix the dressing (a generous cup), corned beef, and drained (but not rinsed) sauerkraut together, and put in the Pam sprayed pan first. Topped with bread cubes, then covered with sprayed foil. Baked for 20 minutes. Removed foil, topped with Swiss cheese, returned to oven until cheese is melted. This is a fantastic recipe if you love Reuben sandwiches. Everyone who has tasted it absolutely loves this. I don’t understand any of the low reviews.

I’ve made this dish twice now and it was excellent both times. Flipped the order of the dish as suggested by others. Layer of meat, drained sauerkraut, homemade thousand island dressing, shredded Swiss and topped with butter cubed rye bread. Use 9x13 casserole lightly greased and cooked covered 20 min and 10 min uncovered. First time used corned beef but 2nd time didn’t have so I used ham....not same as Reuben but still very tasty variation.

Good, but would make some changes. I did not toast bread but will next time and will probably put it on top as one person suggested. Used 1 c. Of 1000 Island. I did not rinse my sauerkraut. I used beef pastrami for the meat, 2-7 oz. packages. I thought it was about right. My husband said it could have used more meat but liked it otherwise.

2/28/21 - Followed recipe but layered ingredients just a little bit differently, the outcome was the same. I put a layer of the mini rye breads on the bottom of the casserole dish, then added a layer of meat, sauerkraut, cheese and dressing, then another layer of meat, sauerkraut, cheese and dressing and topped with some diced up rye bread cubes. Baked up nice and the topping was crunchy to offset the soft bread on the bottom. Easy and delicious and reheats well!
The recipe was easy and this was a huge hit with my family!! One that will be made again.
Great recipe, but did what other users suggested and layered corned beef, sauerkraut, Russian dressing, Swiss cheese and bread cubes. Delicious!!!
This is very tasty, and easy to make.
I followed reviews and used a whole bottle of thousand island and but bread on top
This was quick and easy. We are gluten free so we omitted the bread layer. It was great! It gave us the flavors of a reuben without the bread. Will definitely make again.

very good!!! I toasted the bread as recommended. Layered the sauerkraut, sprinkled some caraway seeds, and drizzled thousand island dressing. I sprinkled 1/2 of the swiss cheese. added shredded cornbeef (leftovers from St. Patrick's Day), another drizzle of thousand island dressing, and remaining swiss cheese. Crushed up some of the toasted bread and sprinkled on top. Covered with aluminum foil and baked for 40 min. YUMMY!!!
I used Thousand island dressing instead of Russian, sliced swiss cheese to layer and shredded Italian cheese on top. This casserole was delicious! My son loved it!
I made it gluten free using Canyon Bakehouse gluten free deli rye style bread, and alpine Swiss slices. It was excellent,
My wife loved it, to sweet for me.

This is delicious! My husband asked why we’ve never made it before!!!
For Vegetarians: I made 1/2 of the dish vegetarian by replacing the corned beef with fresh spinach and little diced onion, then followed recipe exactly.
The other half was made with corned beef exactly as stated.
I did toast the bread cubes in the oven while it was preheating as suggested by another reviewer.
 It was delicious.
THANK YOU FOR SHARING YOUR DELICIOUS RECIPE!!!
Buttered the pan and used pumpernickel bread. We really liked it!

I loved this casserole. I spread sauerkraut on bottom, put layer of torn up deli corned beef (1/2 lb), and layered half and half mayo and chili sauce with sweet pickle relish for dressing and baked for 20 min. Then the last 10 minutes I put toasted cubed rye bread and Swiss cheese over top.

great recipe so glad I forked out the cash. accidentally bought bavarian souerkraut which I wasn't too stoked on so I even had to go back to the store . . so worth it tho.

helpful tips: 4oz swiss cheese is grated into 2 cups.
2x cheese and 1.5x dressing.
toast bread beforehand for 15 min at 350F.
layered with bread, meat, souerkraut, dressing then swiss cheese; then repeated once.

next time: asiago bread and rye

My husband loves Reuben sandwiches, hard to find around here. I on the other do not like sauerkrat....but...made this up, except... 1) did not use bread, used tortilla to roll ingredients into , saved cheese for top 2)cooked about 15 min 3) topped with cheese and cooked another 5-10m
We both thought it was good, will make again.
Delicious - family ate every bite. Only change I made was using Thousand Island instead of Russian. Will make again!

Perfect! I did use real corned beef...I used the slow cooker and once it was done I followed the recipe exactly. I did drain the sauerkraut and found the bread did not get mushy at all. I would make again and I liked using the real corned beef!

Made this for the first time for a potluck and received rave reviews! Even noticed a few going back for seconds. I did use thousand island dressing and about 1/4 pound more meat. My husband loves it too. Definitely will make this again.

Was good but I think I will try it with Thousand Island dressing next time. I used Marble Rye bread from the bakery and it worked really well. I also used a packaged corn beef brisket that I cooked on the stove and then broke apart for in the recipe.
The only change was using homemade saurkraut. I will definitely make this again. It was really good and easy to make.
Definitely make it again

This is not a cheap dish, but it was easy and tasted great . I did toast torn-up bread first, and probably used 1 cup of dressing. 
As good or better as leftovers. Loved it!
Fantastic!

THIS recipe was just ok, made it once before following this to the T. Made it today with some tweaks and it was perfection. Used marbled rye, toasted in the oven first, I doubled the dressing and used thousand island. Didnt rinse the sauerkraut, and used 20 oz canned drained really well. Also added a bit of spicey brown mustard. Its extremely filling, and would have been quick to make if I didnt have to shred the swiss myself (thanks walmart smh). Hubby and our 1, 2, and 6 year old girls devoured it.
Big hit
Everyone loved this. Super easy. Added more bread onto top layer before cooking then topped with Swiss for the last ten minutes. Used both hearty and pumpernickel rye. Delicious!!!
I tried it. it was very good. my company enjoyed it

Made this..,. And it came out delicious. I did toast the bread first and butter the bottom of the pan. I also layered the meat, sauerkraut, dressing twice with a layer cheese in the middle. This came out perfect. Better than making the sandwiches individually. Will placed this recipe in the cookbook of favorites for the family.

This recipe was a definite hit! I was concerned about all the reviews about soggy bread, but I had absolutely no problems. I did follow a few of the tweaks others had posted. I diced up the loaf of marbled rye bread (My husband had me leave him a couple of slices so he could make a sandwich while waiting for dinner ??) and let it sit in the pan to air dry (like stuffing). When putting together the casserole, I layered the bread in the bottom of the baking dish thick enough where I couldn’t see the dish through it, reserving some for the top of the casserole. I spread on half of the meat (I had cut a heavy pound into bite sized strips) on the bread, then half of the pint of drained & squeezed sauerkraut, then evenly spread/ parred on a heavy half cup of thousand island dressing (probably around 2/3), then 1-1 1/2c of cheese. I then spread on the rest of the meat, sauerkraut, and dressing (same amounts as the first layer). I sprinkled the remaining bread on the top of the casserole, covered, and baked as directed, including removing foil and adding/baking the 2 C. of Swiss cheese. It came out perfectly. Served with dill pickles, garlic rounds w/cheese dip, and coleslaw, it was a great meal. I wondered about adding a bit more dressing next time, but my husband vetoed it. My sister in law said maybe so. I decided to make it exactly this way in the future and just putting a little pitcher of more dressing on the table for those who want it saucier. I was asked for the re
I made it Gluten Free using Schar Deli Style Bread.

Very good
Even the fussy 3 year old cleaned her plate
Made it for Mother's Day lunch - one with Turkey and one with Corned Beef. EVERYONE loved it! Will definitely be making again - already have requests!
Why didn't I find this years ago? It's way too logical!

I love Reubens! This was terrific. I make my own rye bread and thousand island dressing (FYI, known as Russian dressing in some parts of the US.) I used leftover corned beef, toasted the rye bread, and made two layers of everything in my Ninja slow cooker, 3 hours on low, 1/2 hour on high. It definitely needed more dressing but that didn't detract from the taste. Next time I won't drain the sauerkraut so well.
I made it according to direction and it was fabulous. My friend and I almost ate the entire pan of food.
Followed recipe to the letter and it was fabulous. Made some cole slaw to go with it and had a lot of leftovers which by the way are great even cold! Happy St Patrick’s Day!

I reversed order of casserole items to avoid soggy bread. However simple croutons would have made the trick. For this dish, rye bread does nothing for recipe so save time & money by using croutons. While it tasted good, if you want a Reuben, go make a sandwich.
quick, easy and excellent! I used pumpernickel rye swirled bread and took the advice of another reviewer by toasting the bread first. Will definitely make this again!

Expensive but looks ten times better than the originals picture.

Used shredded saurkraut that comes in a bag.
Used store brand thousand island-used 1 cup.
Used rye swirl bread- 6 pieces cubed on bottom, 4 slices cubed on top.

Sprayed pam on bottom of casserole. Layered bread, saurkraut, dressing,cheese, then bread. Sprayed pam on top bread layer. Sprayed pam on foil side down. Covered dish and baked at 400 for 30-35 minutes. 

Was a hit!

This is very good! I took the advice of some other reviewers and toasted the bread so it didn't get too soggy. I also put horseradish cheese under the Swiss cheese because I thought it would be tasty... It was! Love this Reuben casserole!
exellent

This was so so good!!! The only changes I made were extra swiss and extra thousand islands, also I put the bread on the top and brushed it with butter. Thanks to all the reviewers tips. 
 Turned out perfect and I will never make this the normal way again!!
It was delcious. Definitely toast the bread lightly, unless you like it soggy. Very rich. Will make again.
My Husband and I loved it! Made it as recipe called. Will make again.

My family liked this casserole but it was better with a few changes. We added a bag of egg noodles and and a full bottle of thousand island dressing to the mix. We did not add the bread to the bottom, but rather toasted it in the toaster, then made crumbs in the food processor. We added some butter and sprinkled the bread mixture over the top. It ends up being a nice hearty casserole!

Make sure your deli corned beef is lean, there is nothing worse than biting into fat and gristle. I have them chip it and then I cut it up in smaller pieces and mix it with my sauerkraut and thousand Island dressing and put in a casserole dish sprayed with Pam. on top of that I add shredded Swiss cheese. I cut my Rye bread into crouton size pieces ,toast them in the oven and cover the casserole with them, drizzling them with a little bit of melted butter. Cover with foil bake, then right before it is done cooking I sprinkle with a little bit more Swiss cheese and bake until it is melted.
I would make this again. I did add more sauerkraut , just drained but didn't rinse it. I also used Thousand Island and more than it called for.

The only thing I did differently from the original recipe was that I didn't rinse the sauerkraut. It's a quick and easy recipe that tastes just like a Reuben sandwich. My husband and I both loved it and I'll be making it again.

We loved it! I did make changes, though. I mixed it all in a bowl and then put it into the casserole dish. I also used a mixture of pastrami and corned beef, and I buttered the bread before I cubed it. ;) We are making this again next week for Super Bowl Sunday.
Super easy, great flavor.
Flavors were good. Just not what we expected. Used Thousand Island dressing. Expensive to make also. Will keep in my favorite list and try it again.

Yes! Making this for the 3rd time. I use good quality deli corned beef & toss some thin dill pickle strips on that layer. I added a sprinkle of the sauerkraut juice & a little brown mustard to the dressing (a personal preference). Ground up caraway seeds skattered on the rye kicks up the flavor. The swiss can be sliced & cut into strips if you like. You can make ahead, storing without the dressing for a few hours - adding before baking & addition of cheese. It does NOT disappoint real reuben lovers!
Really yummy! Really easy. I left out the bread though, and just layered everything else. When done, I put on toasty buns.
I have made this three times and love it!
Followed the instructions. We a little apprehensive of the Russian dressing, but the meal was great!

Did not change a thing. This was wonderful and easy to make.
Oops I did down size to serve 3.
Different, Stickin to the Sandwich.

This recipe was really good. My husband thought it could use a little more dressing, so I'll probably do that next time. We substituted pastrami for the corned beef because hubby doesn't like corned beef. It was tasty with the added bonus of being quick and easy to assemble.
This was pretty good, but I wouldn't buy corned beef to make it. I would have to have left over corned beef that I needed to use up.

My husband liked this. I did the upside down thing to have the crispy bread on top! I used pumpernickel bread. I also used the thousand island dressing. Added more sauerkraut & cheese. I am not crazy about the meat but my husband loves meat. I got nice lean slices from the deli & cut them in strips. Not too thin slices. It is a nice change of menu & is easy with easy clean up! Be sure to drain the sauerkraut or it will be soupy.

Try cutting the bread cubes in 1\4 to1/2 cubes. Then toast on a sheet pan . Place toasted cubes on bottom of casserole. This give more stability. Also you could try melting a thin layer of sliced Swiss over the cubes to form a moisture barrier. Layer.(...BE SURE SOURKRAUT IS VERY WLL DRAINED.)

I added extra sauerkrat and sour cream , chesse and butter for top. I made one 13 by 9. and a 8x8 pan.( this pan I did'nt use thousand island dressing. (Just the sour cream).Shared alot with my neighbors. It was awesome. Will make again.

This was outstanding. My boys and husband loved it. The only difference, in the way I made it, was I used crockpot corned beef, thousand island dressing, half provolone and half Swiss cheese. (Because sometimes Swiss cheese can over power the other flavor's.)

Very rich! Very good. Shredded left over St Paddy days corn beef, added half again as much sauerkraut, doubled the cheese, toasted the cubed bread crumbs and increased the Russian dressing to a cup (drizzled even more on top). Mixed all together and placed in crock pot on low for a couple hours. Yummy!
Mmmmmm....I make this every year for St. Patrick's Day and truly LOVE it!!!

I have never had such mixed feelings about a food. When I first took it out of the oven bites that had a small amount of sauerkraut were amazing. Yet there were some bites with way too much (my own fault) which were horrible. 
I will likely make it again, but with half the amount of sauerkraut and more dressing.
Tip: I toasted my bread and dried my sauerkraut and did not have soggy bread.

I made this exactly as recipe states. I think it was ok, but not nearly as good as the sandwich itself. In fact, given the ingredients, I think I'd rather make the sandwich next time, only I would have used thousand island dressing.
Delicious, I feel spoiled when I have this

This was excellent. Reubens are one of my favorite sandwiches, so this was nice to have something a little different for dinner. 

The only thing I did different was melted butter and tossed the bread crumbs in it, the put them on top to get crispy. So good!!

This was just like a Reuben. I followed the advice of other reviewers and inverted the casserole so the bread was on top and the meat on the bottom. Make sure to bake long enough so the bread stays toasted (a little toasting won't do it or it will get soggy faster). I will make this again. It is easy, quick and good.

I made this for The first time today, I took the advice of another reviewer and toasted the bread in fear that the bread would be soggy. I drained the sourkrout with no reserve. I assembled as directed and found it was a bit dry, I think it needed some juice from the sourkrout (maybe) it was good everyone liked it.. It was just short of something. I think it's a fun recipe and I would try to make it again, and maybe follow another's reviewer and make it in reverse order?.

Love this recipe especially the day after St. Patrick's. Read several reviews and the tips were very helpful. I toasted the bread and cut into cubes. Layered the bottom of a sprayed 9 X 13. Mixed all the remaining ingredients with 1/2 of the cheese. Made it easier to assemble than layers. Put the mixture on top of the cubes and baked per the original recipe. Topped with the other 1/2 of the cheese for the last 10-15 minutes. Let it sit for 10 minutes before cutting so it stays together.
Very yummy! I made it the upside down way as one of the reviews recommended. I halved the recipe and i tossed the bread cubes in 3 tbs. melted butter.

Reuben's are my favorite sandwich,so I definitely had to try this I have to say it was wonderful and I thank you for sharing it...I just added a bit more cheese and used 1000 dressing it was fantastic thank you.
I made it upside down as others stated, but kept everything else the same. It was really good provided you like Reubens to begin with. I will definitely make this again. Thanks for the recipe!
I loved how easy this was! Only changes I made was to add a full 16 oz bottle of Thousand Island dressing and 3 cups of swiss cheese instead of 2.
I love this recipe. I used 1000 Island instead of Russian because Russian sounded too sweet and 1000 Island is what they normally use on the sandwich. If you like Reubens, you'll love this.

Added extra sauce, less meat, toasted the bread, and this was delicious. This did almost taste exactly like the sandwich. Especially nice if you have young kids; you can just make this up quick and then throw it in the oven whenever you want.
